Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing the Trachway and Airway Scope for Tracheal Intubation by Novice Operators

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised cross-over study was conducted in a simulated setting.

Participants.evidence: Participants were novice operators with no prior experience in tracheal intubation.

Intervention.evidence: The study compared the Trachway and Airway Scope in routine and difficult intubation scenarios.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate its effectiveness compared to the Airway Scope in tracheal intubation by novice operators.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time required for successful tracheal intubation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was achieved using a computer-generated sequence, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable due to the nature of the intervention.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 50 participants were randomised, with each participant using both devices.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The average intubation time did not differ significantly between the Trachway and Airway Scope in the normal airway scenario (11.2 ± 6.5 vs. 9.8 ± 4.3 seconds; p = 0.07).
